content:
• Monday, August 8, 2011

  • Nymex crude oil futures pare another -5.2% in overnight trade, down $4.23 to $77.08 a barrel as...

    Nymex crude oil futures pare another -5.2% in overnight trade, down $4.23 to $77.08 a barrel as financial markets in Asia tumble.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 PM | 5 Comments

  • Asian markets tumble as worries about a slowing U.S economy send shockwaves across the Pacific....

    Asian markets tumble as worries about a slowing U.S economy send shockwaves across the Pacific. "You can't control it," says one analyst cutting to the chase when talking about the word of the day...fear. Asian markets: Japan -4.1%, Hong Kong -2.2%, Taiwan -3.8%, South Korea -4.8%, Australia -4.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 PM | 2 Comments
  • HL

    Many gold miners did better than most on an ugly day (where gold climbed another 0.3% to...

    Many gold miners did better than most on an ugly day (where gold climbed another 0.3% to $1,717.70), but none quite as well as Canada's Aurizon Mines (AZK), up 7.6% today on heavy volume. Nevsun Resources (NSU +5.3%) also moved strong. (Canadian producers gain)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:09 PM
  • SPWR

    Brigantine Advisors downgraded SunPower (SPWRA -9.2%, SPWRB -9.5%) to Sell today, arguing the...

    Brigantine Advisors downgraded SunPower (SPWRA -9.2%, SPWRB -9.5%) to Sell today, arguing the company will lose solar module share as competitors prove able to slash prices at a faster rate. However, Cowen is reiterating an Outperform, believing the solar industry is in a consolidation phase that will benefit the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:34 PM
  • YOKU

    More on Youku.com's (NYSE:YOKU) Q2 results: Bandwidth costs were 33% of revenues, down from 65%...

    More on Youku.com's (NYSE:YOKU) Q2 results: Bandwidth costs were 33% of revenues, down from 65% in Q2 2010. Content costs were 25% of revenues, down from 26%. Gross margin was 26.7%, up from -16.5%. Capex rose 147% to $2.9M. YOKU now +0.8% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:26 PM | 1 Comment
  • YOKU

    Youku.com (NYSE:YOKU): Q2 EPS of -$0.04 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $30.6M (+178% Y/Y) beats by...

    Youku.com (NYSE:YOKU): Q2 EPS of -$0.04 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $30.6M (+178% Y/Y) beats by $4.1M. Brand advertising revenue +181% Y/Y, driven by increase in both advertisers and average revenue per advertiser. Company expects Q3 revenue growth of 110%-120%. YOKU -3.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:14 PM
  • MGM

    More on MGM's Q2 results: Casino revenue at wholly owned domestic resorts up just 1% Y/Y, but...

    More on MGM's Q2 results: Casino revenue at wholly owned domestic resorts up just 1% Y/Y, but rooms revenue was up 9%. MGM China (51% stake) revenues rose 118% Y/Y to $668M. As of 6/30, the company had $922M in cash and equivalents (including MGM China's cash), and $12.8B in debt. MGM now +0.5% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM
  • KWK

    Quicksilver Resources (NYSE:KWK) shed -22% today, after investors shrugged off a decent Q2...

    Quicksilver Resources (NYSE:KWK) shed -22% today, after investors shrugged off a decent Q2 earnings report and focused on the oil driller's increasing debt . Of chief concern is that the company will outspend cash flow, as its 71% net debt-to-capitalization ratio is well above the peer group average of 45%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM
  • TTWO

    More on Take-Two's (NASDAQ:TTWO) FQ1 results: FY12 guidance for revenue of $1B-$1.1B and EPS of...

    More on Take-Two's (NASDAQ:TTWO) FQ1 results: FY12 guidance for revenue of $1B-$1.1B and EPS of $0.10-$0.35, while below consensus, doesn't look as bad as FQ2 guidance. But given the magnitude of the FQ2 miss, investors may be skeptical. Digitally delivered content sales were up 49% Y/Y, but only accounted for 7.4% of revenue. TTWO now -7.2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM

  • Treasury yields sank as investors didn't think twice about parking money in sovereign debt rated...

    Treasury yields sank as investors didn't think twice about parking money in sovereign debt rated a mere AA. Treasury bond yields: 7-year -20 points to 1.72%, 10-year -21 points to 2.35%, 30-year -18 points to 3.67%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • TTWO

    Take-Two Interactive (NASDAQ:TTWO): FQ1 EPS of $0.02 misses by $0.08. Revenue of $334.4M (-11%...

    Take-Two Interactive (NASDAQ:TTWO): FQ1 EPS of $0.02 misses by $0.08. Revenue of $334.4M (-11% Y/Y) misses by $18.5M. Expects FQ2 revenue of $70M-$85M and EPS of -$0.65 to -$0.55, well below a consensus of $203.2M and -$0.05. Shares halted AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • AIMC

    Mechanical design engineering and manufacturer Altra (AIMC -26%) picked a bad day to report an...

    Mechanical design engineering and manufacturer Altra (AIMC -26%) picked a bad day to report an earnings miss. The stock has been clobbered after missing both EPS and revenues estimates for Q2, despite a 24% increase in Y/Y sales, and lowering its FY11 guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • ZOLL

    ZOLL Medical (ZOLL -24%) gets crushed after revealing it's facing a potential revision by...

    ZOLL Medical (ZOLL -24%) gets crushed after revealing it's facing a potential revision by Medicare over how much it will pay to cover the cost of the company's defibrillators, including its LiveVest product. The outlined cuts could have "a material adverse effect on its LifeVest business," the company says.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • SPGI

    McGraw-Hill (MHP -7.7%) suffers from guilt-by-association, as the parent company of S&P gets...

    McGraw-Hill (MHP -7.7%) suffers from guilt-by-association, as the parent company of S&P gets hit by criticism from government officials over the ratings agency's downgrade of the U.S. sovereign credit rating.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM | 3 Comments
  • NEM

    Newmont Mining (NEM +1.7%) has the distinction - for the moment, at least - of being the one and...

    Newmont Mining (NEM +1.7%) has the distinction - for the moment, at least - of being the one and only stock trading in positive territory on the S&P 500 today.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • SMG

    Shares of Scotts Miracle-Gro (SMG -12.2%) sink after the firms trims its FY11 EPS forecast to...

    Shares of Scotts Miracle-Gro (SMG -12.2%) sink after the firms trims its FY11 EPS forecast to $2.95-$3.05, from $3.10-$3.20. A 20% dividend hike couldn't offset a ghastly Y/Y 37% drop in net income and 10% loss in net sales. The firm's CEO described the effect of weather as "unparalleled during my life-long tenure in this industry."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM | 2 Comments
  • SUN

    Crude oil has cratered along with the acceration in equities selling, now down -6.4%. Oil stocks...

    Crude oil has cratered along with the acceration in equities selling, now down -6.4%. Oil stocks are some of the day's biggest losers: Sunoco (SUN -12.3%), Marathon Petroleum (MPC -16%), Tesoro (TSO -14.9%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • MSFT

    On an ugly day, LinkedIn (LNKD -18.9%) is falling harder than most. Evercore, which downgraded...

    On an ugly day, LinkedIn (LNKD -18.9%) is falling harder than most. Evercore, which downgraded the company on Friday following earnings, today named LinkedIn a Conviction Sell. Other tech names down over 10%: APKT -11.6%. RAX -12.6%. ALU -14%. JDSU -12.7%. CIEN -10.9%. YNDX -12.6%. N -10.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM

  • The CBOE Volatility Index (VIX +33.5%) is skyrocketing, reflecting systemic market fear, and now...

    The CBOE Volatility Index (VIX +33.5%) is skyrocketing, reflecting systemic market fear, and now stands higher than anytime since the darkest days of the financial crisis of 2008-2009.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM | 3 Comments
  • LPS

    Lender Processing Services (LPS -7.3%) gets hit by a double-whammy after Macquarie cuts the...

    Lender Processing Services (LPS -7.3%) gets hit by a double-whammy after Macquarie cuts the stock to underperform in response to S&P's downgrade of the U.S. credit rating. The firm says the mortgage originations market is likely to be "more challenging than previously thought."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM
  • WETF

    Horizon Kinetics' Murray Stahl says he's a "big investor" in public ETF company WisdomTree (WETF...

    Horizon Kinetics' Murray Stahl says he's a "big investor" in public ETF company WisdomTree (WETF +3.1%), and that an "informed investor" might pay $14-$15/share for the stock, more than double its current price. Citigroup reiterates WETF as its top small-cap name among asset managers, seeing the company separating itself from the pack.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • CF

    CF Industries (CF -4.6%) receives a slew of upgrades from analysts following last week's strong...

    CF Industries (CF -4.6%) receives a slew of upgrades from analysts following last week's strong Q2 report. Barclay's moves shares to Equal Weight, and sets a price target increase to $170. Ticonderoga chips in with a Buy rating, and a $200 price target. Feltl comes in the most bullish, seeing a $235 share price in the offing.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM
  • BHC

    Valeant Pharmaceuticals (MRX -0.5%) has approached Medicis (MRX +4.8%) about a possible...

    Valeant Pharmaceuticals (MRX -0.5%) has approached Medicis (MRX +4.8%) about a possible takeover, WSJ reports. The approach comes amid an investigation into the unusual death of the Medicis CEO's girlfriend. An acquisition of Medicis would fit with Valeant's stated goal of becoming the world's biggest player in the skincare sector.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM
  • FNMA

    Mortgage-backed securities (MBB +0.2%) gain slightly even after S&P lowers its rating on...

    Mortgage-backed securities (MBB +0.2%) gain slightly even after S&P lowers its rating on Fannie Mae (OTCQB:FNMA), Freddie Mac (OTCQB:FMCC) and FHLBs, although yield spreads versus Treasurys widened. Analysts expect the bigger concern for mortgage securities is increased interest-rate volatility and uncertainty on prepayments.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM
  • LVS

    Casino stocks (BJK -5.6%) fall apart as investors second-guess how gaming firms will boost...

    Casino stocks (BJK -5.6%) fall apart as investors second-guess how gaming firms will boost profits in the midst of an economic slowdown, and with trillions in wealth now pulverized. Analysts were banking on prospects in Macau lifting the bottom lines of casinos, optimism that now seems dated. Leading decliners: LVS -8.8%, MPEL -12%, MGM -9.2%, PNK -7.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM | 1 Comment
  • GG

    Canadian gold stocks are getting a lift from the yellow metal's flight-to-safety runup today:...

    Canadian gold stocks are getting a lift from the yellow metal's flight-to-safety runup today: Goldcorp (GG +4.7%), Kinross Gold (KGC +1.4%), Barrick Gold (ABX +4.8%).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM

  • Commodity prices get slammed as economic fears intensify with some metals breaking through what...

    Commodity prices get slammed as economic fears intensify with some metals breaking through what is seen as important technical levels. Any current projections for commodity prices now need to be wadded up and be given a fresh macro look. Leading the downward spiral: Steel SLZ -7.4%, Copper JJC -7%, Tin JJT -6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM
  • JASO

    JA Solar (JASO -10.9%) takes it on the chin today after saying it expects Q2 gross margins to be...

    JA Solar (JASO -10.9%) takes it on the chin today after saying it expects Q2 gross margins to be lower-than-expected due a decline in prices and the impact of higher-cost inventory provisions. Separately, the company announces a $100M share repurchase.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM
  • RES

    RPC (RES +11.5%) clocks a big gain after a report says the firm hired Goldman Sachs for advice...

    RPC (RES +11.5%) clocks a big gain after a report says the firm hired Goldman Sachs for advice as it considers a sale of the company. The oil services business is considered attractive by analysts as it could serve as a quick-entry into the lucrative Eagle Ford and Marcellus shale fields for a major oil player.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM
  • GVA

    Share of Granite Construction (GVA -5.5%) fall after Goldman lowers its price target to $22 from...

    Share of Granite Construction (GVA -5.5%) fall after Goldman lowers its price target to $22 from $25, and maintains a Sell rating. The firm also lowers its EPS projections for the infrastructure builder looking forward: FY11 $1.00 vs. $1.10, FY12 $1.20 vs. $1.40, FY13 $1.50 vs. $1.70.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • MS

    Morgan Stanley (MS -9.3%) warns in its 10-Q quarterly report that the S&P downgrade could...

    Morgan Stanley (MS -9.3%) warns in its 10-Q quarterly report that the S&P downgrade could have a "material adverse" impact on its business. The firm also notes in it faces losses of up to $492M plus interest over two derivatives-related lawsuits, plus a $125M charge expected from a U.K. tax.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM

  • A flight-to-quality by investors trumps - by a long shot  - concerns over holding U.S. debt...

    A flight-to-quality by investors trumps - by a long shot  - concerns over holding U.S. debt after S&P's downgrade brings buyers in droves out of stocks and into the now "AA-rated" safe haven. Treasury yields: 2-year -5 points to 0.25%, 5-year -16 points to 1.09%, 10-year -18 points to 2.38%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM | 3 Comments
  • F

    Auto stocks (CARZ -5.1%) suffer even more pain than broad market indices, as investors are...

    Auto stocks (CARZ -5.1%) suffer even more pain than broad market indices, as investors are weighed down by worries about profitability and the ability of consumers to find car loan financing if interest rates increase. Leading the pack of decliners: F -7.1%, GM -6.1%, VLKAY -8.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM
  • MTG

    Shares of interest-sensitive mortgage insurers have been hammered this morning on the S&P...

    Shares of interest-sensitive mortgage insurers have been hammered this morning on the S&P downgrade: MGIC Investment (MTG -17%), Radian Group (RDN -17%), MBIA (MBI -7.3%).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM
  • SPGI

    Legg Mason's Bill Miller issues a scathing critique of S&P’s downgrade, calling it...

    Legg Mason's Bill Miller issues a scathing critique of S&P’s downgrade, calling it “precipitous, wrong, and dangerous," and urging Congress to end the "oligopoly" of NRSROs "before they contribute to or ignite another financial crisis." This sentiment likely is another reason shares of McGraw-Hill (MHP -6.1%) and Moody's (MCO -6.4%) are sharply lower.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM | 12 Comments
  • BAC

    Bank of America (BAC -15.6%) in free-fall now, with the Tepper news apparently being the impetus...

    Bank of America (BAC -15.6%) in free-fall now, with the Tepper news apparently being the impetus for the latest plunge. (previously on BofA)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • LEN

    Home building stocks are big losers today in the wake of S&P's downgrade, as a lower rating...

    Home building stocks are big losers today in the wake of S&P's downgrade, as a lower rating means higher borrowing costs for home buyers. Lennar (LEN -5.5%), PulteGroup (PHM -6%) Beazer Homes (BZH -7.4%), DR Horton (DHI -4%).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM | 1 Comment
  • AWAY

    Shares of HomeAway (AWAY -0.3%) pop (relatively) after Goldman Sachs initiates coverage with a...

    Shares of HomeAway (AWAY -0.3%) pop (relatively) after Goldman Sachs initiates coverage with a Buy rating, and says the price could double for ground-floor investors. The firm says it sees AWAY as the dominant player in the emerging online travel vertical.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • BAC

    CNBC's David Faber reports David Tepper has unloaded his stake in Bank of America (BAC -10.3%).

    CNBC's David Faber reports David Tepper has unloaded his stake in Bank of America (BAC -10.3%).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM | 1 Comment
  • ARW

    Goldman's Craig Hettenbach is downgrading IT products distributor Arrow Electronics (ARW -5.1%)...

    Goldman's Craig Hettenbach is downgrading IT products distributor Arrow Electronics (ARW -5.1%) to Neutral, citing weak demand for IT supply chain companies in general. Hettenbach is also slashing estimates and targets for 14 other companies, including rivals AVT and IM, and contract manufacturers JBL, FLEX, and SANM. (ARW Q2)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • DNDN

    Dendreon (DNDN -12.4%) is lower this morning after Citadel commented in its new coverage note...

    Dendreon (DNDN -12.4%) is lower this morning after Citadel commented in its new coverage note that Johnson & Johnson's (JNJ -1.45%) Zytiga oral drug is a more convenient treatment for prostate cancer patients than Provenge's intravenous method.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM | 1 Comment
  • DGIT

    Advertising services company DG FastChannel (NASDAQ:DGIT) drops 26.5% after reporting Q2 revenue...

    Advertising services company DG FastChannel (NASDAQ:DGIT) drops 26.5% after reporting Q2 revenue of $67.9M (+17% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.48, below a consensus of $73.6M and $0.52. MediaMind, which DG FastChannel officially acquired on 7/26, saw 22% Y/Y revenue growth for the quarter. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • SPGI

    More on McGraw-Hill (MHP -7.7%): The planned spinoff of S&P could be in jeopardy after...

    More on McGraw-Hill (MHP -7.7%): The planned spinoff of S&P could be in jeopardy after investors punish its parent company, apparently in partial retaliation for the downgrade of U.S. debt. Rival Moody's MCO down 7.5% in sympathy.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM | 7 Comments
  • OMX

    OfficeMax (OMX -12.2%) takes a hit this morning as Goldman downgrades the shares to neutral,...

    OfficeMax (OMX -12.2%) takes a hit this morning as Goldman downgrades the shares to neutral, saying "we see a challenged firm, in a challenged sector, with few catalysts, and an operating leverage profile that could work against it in a downturn." The firm raises its H2 forecast, but cuts 2012 and 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • USM

    Regional carrier U.S. Cellular (USM -4.9%) is following the market lower after reporting Q2...

    Regional carrier U.S. Cellular (USM -4.9%) is following the market lower after reporting Q2 results. Service revenue grew 3% Y/Y, average revenue per user increased 2.6% Q/Q, and churn declined slightly to 1.38%. However, the company had a net loss of 58K retail subscribers, including 41K postpaid subscribers. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM

  • An attempt at buying the open fails as markets sink to their lows of the day, both here and...

    An attempt at buying the open fails as markets sink to their lows of the day, both here and across the pond. S&P 500 -3.1%, Nasdaq -3.4%, Stoxx 50 -2.5%. The hardest hit market thus far, Germany -4.0%. Best performers: Italy and Spain -1.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM | 1 Comment

  • The market's volatility gauge (VIX +15%) shot as high as 37, before settling back a bit this...

    The market's volatility gauge (VIX +15%) shot as high as 37, before settling back a bit this morning. The VIX marched past its March high, a barrier technical traders see opening the door for even larger spikes.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM
  • AAL

    Several airline stocks are underperforming in the wake of S&P's downgrade, as investors fear...

    Several airline stocks are underperforming in the wake of S&P's downgrade, as investors fear a decline in business travel. LCC -5.2%. JBLU -3.1%. AMR -6.1%. RYAAY -4.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • LPL

    LG Display (NYSE:LPL) is down 9.5% premarket after taking a beating in Asian markets. A top LG...

    LG Display (NYSE:LPL) is down 9.5% premarket after taking a beating in Asian markets. A top LG exec says global sales of LCD screens will be lower than the 215M units forecast, although stops short of issuing official guidance. Additional pressure on LG's profits is coming from the appreciation of South Korea's currency against the U.S. dollar.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM
  • BA

    Goldman Sachs adds Boeing (NYSE:BA) to its Conviction List saying the firm is in the midst of a...

    Goldman Sachs adds Boeing (NYSE:BA) to its Conviction List saying the firm is in the midst of a large 787 product cycle, positioning it for a big gain in orders and a Q3 earnings boost. Goldman's price target of $86 suggests a healthy 37% upswing. Shares -2.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:54 AM
  • BAC

    Bank of America (BAC -8%) is again the worst performer among the large financials, dropping to a...

    Bank of America (BAC -8%) is again the worst performer among the large financials, dropping to a $7 handle in premarket trading and its CDS jumping nearly 10% to 235 bps. The generalized stock decline hurts, but the lender's legacy assets and continuing legal troubles are the main focus.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:43 AM | 2 Comments
  • RDS.A

    Royal Dutch Shell (NYSE:RDS.A) receives an upgrade from Oppenheimer to Outperform from Market...

    Royal Dutch Shell (NYSE:RDS.A) receives an upgrade from Oppenheimer to Outperform from Market Perform with a price target of $80. The firm sees the Big Oil player realizing a nice earnings and cash flow boost following its $60B investment in projects over the last 5 years. Shares -2.6% premarket, in-line with other oil majors.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:22 AM
  • HBAN

    Huntington Bancshares (NASDAQ:HBAN) looks ripe for a poor opening as shares trade down 7.4%...

    Huntington Bancshares (NASDAQ:HBAN) looks ripe for a poor opening as shares trade down 7.4% premarket without a wisp of news. A quick peak at other bank stocks premarket shows a similar sea of red for the sector: WFC -2.3%,  RF -5.9%, FITB -2.8%, BK -2.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:14 AM
  • CSCO

    BroadSoft (BSFT), a developer of communications software for service providers, is up 20%...

    BroadSoft (BSFT), a developer of communications software for service providers, is up 20% premarket after reporting Q2 revenue of $32.2M (+63%) and EPS of $0.29, blowing away a consensus of $28.9M and $0.12. The company now expects 2011 revenue of $127M-$130M and EPS of $0.90-$0.95, above a consensus of $125.2M and $0.75.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:08 AM
  • MGA

    Shares of Magna (NYSE:MGA) fell 10.9% Friday on a weak Q2 earnings report, but Deutsche Bank...

    Shares of Magna (NYSE:MGA) fell 10.9% Friday on a weak Q2 earnings report, but Deutsche Bank reiterates at Hold with only a $2 haircut on its price target to $55 from $57. UBS says margin guidance issued by the firm will push consensus estimates lower, an expectation that may already be baked into the share price.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:47 AM
  • AIG

    AIG (AIG -3.2%) reportedly plans to sue BofA (BAC -4.5%) for misrepresenting the quality of...

    AIG (AIG -3.2%) reportedly plans to sue BofA (BAC -4.5%) for misrepresenting the quality of hundreds of mortgage-backed securities and is looking to recover more than $10B in losses. AIG is also prepping similar suits against banks including Goldman Sachs (GS -3.3%), JPMorgan (JPM -1.9%) and Deutsche Bank (DB -1.8%).

     
     
     
     
    | 7:27 AM

  • As expected, Asian markets tumble following Friday's S&P downgrade and despite statements...

    As expected, Asian markets tumble following Friday's S&P downgrade and despite statements from the ECB and G7 aimed at calming the situation. Japan -2.2%, Hong Kong -3.2%, China -3.5%, and S&P Benchmark futures -1.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 AM | 2 Comments
